Title: Chemoarchitectonics and corticocortical terminations within the superior temporal sulcus of the rhesus monkey: evidence for subdivisions of superior temporal polysensory cortex
Abstract:
Cortex of the upper bank of the superior temporal sulcus (STS) in macaque monkeys, termed the superior temporal polysensory (STP) region, corresponds largely to architectonic area TPO and is connectionally distinct from adjacent visual areas. To investigate whether or not the STP region contains separate
subdivisions, immunostaining for parvalbumin and neurofilament protein (using the SMI-32 antibody) was compared with patterns of corticocortical terminations in the STS. Chemoarchitectonic results provided evidence for three caudal-to-rostral subdivisions: TPOc, TPOi, and TPOr. Area TPOc was characterized by patchy
staining for parvalbumin and SMI-32 in cortical layers IV/III and III, respectively. Area TPOi had more uniform chemoarchitectonic staining, whereas area TPOr had a thicker layer IV than TPOi. The connectional results showed prefrontal cortex in the location of the frontal eye fields (area 8) and dorsal area 46 projected in a
columnar pattern to all cortical layers of area TPOc, to layer IV of TPOi, and in a columnar fashion, with a moderate increase in density in layer IV, to TPOr. In TPOc, columns of frontal connections showed a periodicity similar to that of the SMI-32 staining. The caudal inferior parietal lobule (area 7a) and superior
temporal gyrus projected to each subdivision of area TPO, displaying either panlaminar or fourth-layer terminations. In addition to STP cortex, parvalbumin and SMI-32 immunostaining allowed identification of caudal visual areas of the STS,
including MT, MST, FST, and V4t. These areas received first- and sixth-layer projections from prefrontal cortex and area 7a.

(p. 516)

@BrainMaps_UnspecificAdoption.Citation: "Projections from area 7a to the STP region have been described as "mixed," i.e., as showing patches of feedback connections (Andersen et al., 1990)."
@BrainMaps_UnspecificAdoption.Comments: Unspecific adoption, because on p. 533 the author says:"...and area 7a (Seltzer and Panday, 1989a, 1994)." -but area 7a is not mentioned in this articles.

@InterMapRelations.Citation: "Projections from area 7a to the STP region have been described as "mixed," i.e., as showing patches of feedback connections (Andersen et al., 1990)."

"The medial and rostral borders of the fundal superior temporal area, FST, with MST and IPa, respectively, were not well demonstrated by the present methods, and the extent of FST is thus estimates from previous studies (Ungerleider and Desimone, 1986b)."
"This region was therefore interpreted to correspond to area MTp (Ungerleider and Desimone, 1986a) and was included within MT on the cortical reconstructions (e.g., Fig. 1)."

"Area V4t, from Ungerleider and Desimone (1986a,b), is considered here to enclose partly area MT caudally."
"The present area IPa previously included both rostral areas PGa and IPa (Seltzer and Pandya, 1978)."

"Area TPOc also appears to be included in posterior parietal (PP) cortex of Desimone and Ungerleider (1986) and the caudal superior temporal polymodal region (cSTP) described by Hikosaka et al. (1988)."

@Injections.Citation: "In the third case , TMJ (Fig. 11, bottom), the injection site, of [3H]-proline and [3H]-leucine, infiltrated the dorsal prearcuate area and upper bank of the principal sulcus but did not involve cortex in the bend of the arcuate sulcus as far laterally as in the other two cases." (pp. 524-525)

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "In each case, labeled terminations were found over a broad rostrocaudal extent of the upper bank and fundus of the STS. Laminar terminations discriminated between visual and polysensory regions of the STS: in visual area MT and the locations identified as V4t, MST, FST, and area IPa, frontal projections were of feedback type, whereas the TPO subdivisions had either columnar or fourth layer connections."  p. 525

@Injections.Citation: "The injection site in the second case, TMP (Fig. 11, middle), was in the same general location but more restricted to the caudal one-half of the crown of the prearcuate gyrus and adjacent lower bank of the principal sulcus." (p. 524)

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: In each case, labeled terminations were found over a broad rostrocaudal extent of the upper bank and fundus of the STS. Laminar terminations discriminated between visual and polysensory regions of the STS: in visual area MT and the locations identified as V4t, MST, FST, and area IPa, frontal projections were of feedback type, whereas the TPO subdivisions had either columnar or fourth layer connections."  p. 525

@Injections.Citation: "The largest injection site, of [35S]-methionine in case TMQ (Fig. 11, top), involved most of the dorsal wing of area 46 and area 8a (Walker, 1940), including the prearcuate gyrus extending toward the floor of the arcuate sulcus (in the region caudal to the principal sulcus) and, to a slight extent, the lower bank of the principal sulcus in superficial layers." (p. 524)

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: In each case, labeled terminations were found over a broad rostrocaudal extent of the upper bank and fundus of the STS. @Injections.Citation: "Two monkeys (cases TMJ and TMG) recieved 10-12 closely spaced injections of 0.1% WGA-HRP in the exposed surface of the caudal inferior parietal lobule (area 7a), and one monkey (case TMP) had similar injections in the caudal superior temporal gyrus." p. 515
@Injections.Comments: I guess TMG (p. 151)  is a spelling mistake, because otherwise the author refered to a case called TMQ. Also see Fig. 16.  (p. 528)

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "IN both cases, feedback patterns of connections were found in areas MSTl and sparsely in MT and V4t (Figs. 17, 18). ... Neverthless, fourth-layer inputs from area 7a were identified in the location of areas MSTd (Fig. 17), FST, and IPa, rostrally (Figs. 17, 18)." p. 528

@Injections.Citation: Two monkeys (cases TMJ and TMG) recieved 10-12 closely spaced injections of 0.1% WGA-HRP in the exposed surface of the caudal inferior parietal lobule (area 7a), and one monkey (case TMP) had similar injections in the caudal superior temporal gyrus." p. 515
@Injections.Comments: I guess TMG (p. 151)  is a spelling mistake, because otherwise the author refered to a case called TMQ. Also see Fig. 16.  (p. 528)

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "The connections from the exposed surface of the STG (extending slightly onto the lip of STS; Fig. 16, bottom) to the upper bank of the STS clearly avoided the visual areas of the STS, e.g., MT, MST, and FST and of area IPa (Fig. 19). The connections were predominantly to the portions of the sulcus near the same rostrocaudal level as the injection and occupied area TAa and all three divisions of area TPO." p. 529
